Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.openbmc_vboot_util_check.openbmc_vboot_util_check

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.host import Host
import re

''' BMC verified boot checks for the Status Type and code
    errors and reports the error codes.
    if both Status Type and code
    displayes 0 the test passes else fails '''



[docs]class OpenbmcvBootUtil(TestBase):


[docs]    def execute(self):
        self.log_info("This is the Verified boot test")

        self.log_info("Execute vboot-util")
        out = self.host.oob.vboot_util()
        self.validate_vboot_util(out)
        self.validate_condition(
            True, "Verified the vboot-util for error code"
        )



[docs]    def validate_vboot_util(self, out):
        err_val = 0
        for line in out.splitlines():
            line.rstrip('\n')
            match = re.search(r"Status type \(\d+\) code \(\d+\)", line)
            if match:
                err_code = map(int, re.findall(r"\d+", line))
                self.log_info("Error Codes: %s" % line)
                for codes in err_code:
                    if codes is 0:
                        err_val = err_val + 1
        self.validate_condition(
            err_val == 2, "OpenBMC vboot util validation %s" %
            (line)
        )




[docs]def main():
    test = OpenbmcvBootUtil()
    test.lifecycle()



if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
